item.title: Grand Café de Tropen, Amsterdam, Netherlands | Travel | Wallpaper* Magazine
item.description:
Grand Café de Tropen, Amsterdam, Netherlands | Travel | Wallpaper* Magazine

To be frank, Amsterdam's Koninklijk Instituut voor de Tropen, more informally known as the Royal Tropical Institute, is not the first place you'd think of for a lunch of pulled chicken marinated in hoi-sin and star anise. The stately Dutch Gothic Revival pile was designed by J.J.

item.title: Bistro Proti Proudu, Prague, Czech Republic | Travel | Wallpaper* Magazine
item.description:
Bistro Proti Proudu, Prague, Czech Republic | Travel | Wallpaper* Magazine

With an ever-growing number of cool cafés, wine bars and shops, Prague's Karlín district is fast becoming a haven for the hip set. Its latest arrival, is Bistro Proti, a cosy corner eatery with a sleek interior inspired by the neighbourhood's most significant historical figure, engineer František Križík.

item.title: There's brew love in a new lager saga: Daniel Noah Sheikh reinvents beer | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine
item.description:
There's brew love in a new lager saga: Daniel Noah Sheikh reinvents beer | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine

The crafting and consumption of artisanal ale has come to define hipsterdom as surely as unchecked facial hair and tattoos. Lager, once the fashionable brew, has been largely left out in the cold. One young Münchner, though, is determined on rebuilding buzz around bold but bubbly Bavarian beer.

item.title: Finlandia Caviar Shop and Restaurant, Helsinki, Finland | Travel | Wallpaper* Magazine
item.description:
Finlandia Caviar Shop and Restaurant, Helsinki, Finland | Travel | Wallpaper* Magazine

In designing a space that would be devoted primarily to the consumption of caviar, Helsinki-based designer Joanna Laajisto was careful to avoid clichés of outré parties, fur coats and blinding bling.

item.title: 7 Pimm's Cup recipes for spring | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine
item.description:
7 Pimm's Cup recipes for spring | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine

If Spring had an official cocktail, the Pimm's Cup would be it. It's ultra-refreshing, bright and vibrant-and as easy to make as it is to drink. To mix a basic version of the classic British cocktail, all you need is Pimm's No. 1, ginger ale (or some sort of lemon-lime soda), cucumber and lemon.

item.title: Where to Eat Pizza: Phaidon presents the ultimate pizza bucket list | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine
item.description:
Where to Eat Pizza: Phaidon presents the ultimate pizza bucket list | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine

There are two kinds of books in this world: those everyone ought to read, and those that you must own. Phaidon's latest launch, Where To Eat Pizza, is both. Following on from 2015's great success Where Chefs Eat, Daniel Young's Where to Eat Pizza is an anthology of the best pizza places around the globe.

item.title: Drink to Dublin: Jameson enlist artist James Earley to design new label | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine
item.description:
Drink to Dublin: Jameson enlist artist James Earley to design new label | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine

Any visitor to Dublin's fair city will quickly sense the iconic presence of Jameson whiskey, which is woven into the fabric of life in Ireland's capital. The brand began producing whiskey in Dublin in 1780, and has always been closely linked with the city's rich cultural scene, championing its music, literature, and art.
